channel.title: 718-728 can I change a server to local host/offline?
channel.description:
I've payed a friend of mine to put me together a server with spawns and working functions only I want it offline, can I change the host IP then compile the .jar forlder afterwards witohut any software?
if anyone knows of such works please point me in the correct direction, thanks.

item.title: 718-728 can I change a server to local host/offline?
item.dc:creator: @chrisbevan chrisbevan
item.description:
@chrisbevan wrote:

I understand, thank you for the usefull info on making this server local host. I’ll get right onto the de-compiler

Read full topic

item.title: 718-728 can I change a server to local host/offline?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“chrisbevan, post:1, topic:473799”]I’ve payed a friend of mine to put me together a server with spawns and working functions only I want it offline, can I change the host IP then compile the .jar forlder afterwards witohut any software?

if anyone knows of such works please point me in the correct direction, thanks.[/quote]

Your “friend” is ripping you off and taking advantage of your ignorance regarding R.S.P.S.

Yes, you can change the Internet Protocol I.D. to your Local-Host so that it can only be accessed by your machine.

I’m not sure I understand the rest of your question, but you will need a Java De-Compiler to edit your Java Archive Application (J.A.R). You should just edit what you want and then pack the Client.

Read full topic
item.source: 718-728 can I change a server to local host/offline?
